Description: The Flight into Egypt; the Virgin carrying the Child in her arms, riding an ass, led by St Joseph to the right; in the background are two hills and two trees; the border has a rope-pattern; the engraving is pasted onto a detached page of an illuminated manuscript with a decorative border and a Flemish text below Engraving with hand-colouring
Producer name: Print made by: Master of the Martyrdom of the Ten Thousand
Curator's comments: Part of series of 46 engravings (L Nos. 8-53), copied after the Master ES, the Master of the Berlin Passion and others. Three further impressions from the series at the BM have a different provenance and are not coloured. This engraving is one of 42 prints in the BM similarly decorated and inscribed from a Flemish prayerbook formerly in the abbey of St Peter in Ghent, see 1846,0709.22 for full details.
Bibliographic references: Lehrs 1908-34 / Geschichte und kritische Katalog des deutschen, niederländischen und französischen Kupferstichs im XV Jahrhundert (III.365.20)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: A E Evans & Sons
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Jean-Baptiste Delbecq (sale, Paris, Delande and Thoré, 18 Feb 1845, lot no 29)
